pages.raw_output:
<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 259, 460, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 352, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 368, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 415]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 463, 908, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 590, 509]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 606, 525]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 556, 756, 571]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 587]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 588, 907, 618]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 675, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) satisfying the inequality \(3|x - 1| < |2x + 1|\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 97, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 272, 139]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 139, 554, 159]]<|/det|>
\[5^{x - 1} = 5^{x} - 5,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 522, 184]]<|/det|>
giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 166, 920, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 211, 96, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 211, 272, 229]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[379, 230, 618, 250]]<|/det|>
\[\sin (\theta +45^{\circ}) = 2\cos (\theta -30^{\circ}),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 253, 507, 273]]<|/det|>
giving all solutions in the interval \(0^{\circ}< \theta < 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 255, 920, 273]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 301, 96, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 301, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
When \((1 + a x)^{- 2}\), where \(a\) is a positive constant, is expanded in ascending powers of \(x\), the coefficients of \(x\) and \(x^{3}\) are equal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 348, 153, 367]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 348, 364, 367]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 349, 920, 367]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 380, 153, 397]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 380, 920, 414]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) has this value, obtain the expansion up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\), simplifying the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 395, 920, 414]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 446, 96, 465]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 444, 151, 465]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 444, 700, 475]]<|/det|>
By differentiating \(\frac{1}{\cos x}\), show that if \(y = \sec x\) then \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \sec x \tan x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 447, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 488, 153, 507]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 465, 515]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{1}{\sec x - \tan x} \equiv \sec x + \tan x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 509]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 533, 153, 552]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 533, 606, 562]]<|/det|>
Deduce that \(\frac{1}{(\sec x - \tan x)^2} \equiv 2 \sec^2 x - 1 + 2 \sec x \tan x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 534, 920, 552]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 585, 153, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 576, 585, 621]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi} \frac{1}{(\sec x - \tan x)^2} \mathrm{~d}x = \frac{1}{4} (8\sqrt{2} - \pi).\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 590, 920, 609]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 648, 96, 666]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 648, 599, 666]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) are related by the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 672, 556, 702]]<|/det|>
\[x\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = 1 - y^{2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 710, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
When \(x = 2\), \(y = 0\). Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 710, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 757, 96, 776]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 757, 455, 776]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(\ln (xy) - y^{3} = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 791, 153, 811]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 791, 384, 820]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{y}{x(3y^3 - 1)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 794, 920, 812]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 833, 153, 851]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 833, 920, 868]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point where the tangent to the curve is parallel to the \(y\)-axis, giving each coordinate correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 851, 920, 868]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 82, 702, 220]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 238, 806, 262]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2} x^2} \sqrt{(1 + 2x^2)}\) for \(x \geqslant 0\), and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 272, 154, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 272, 527, 291]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 273, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 303, 153, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 303, 589, 322]]<|/det|>
The sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 327, 589, 351]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \sqrt{(\ln(4 + 8x_n^2))},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 355, 920, 390]]<|/det|>
with initial value \(x_{1} = 2\), converges to a certain value \(\alpha\). State an equation satisfied by \(\alpha\) and hence show that \(\alpha\) is the \(x\)-coordinate of a point on the curve where \(y = 0.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 375, 920, 393]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 402, 153, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 402, 920, 437]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula to determine \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 420, 920, 439]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 463, 97, 483]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 463, 917, 483]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(1 + (\sqrt{2})\mathrm{i}\) is denoted by \(u\). The polynomial \(x^{4} + x^{2} + 2x + 6\) is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 496, 154, 514]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 496, 920, 530]]<|/det|>
Showing your working, verify that \(u\) is a root of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\), and write down a second complex root of the equation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 528, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 540, 153, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 541, 552, 560]]<|/det|>
Find the other two roots of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 542, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 588, 106, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 587, 771, 606]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\), the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[288, 612, 710, 657]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \begin{pmatrix} 3 \\ -2 \\ 4 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \overrightarrow{OB} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1 \\ 7 \end{pmatrix} \quad \text{and} \quad \overrightarrow{OC} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -5 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 670, 539, 692]]<|/det|>
The plane \(m\) is parallel to \(\overrightarrow{OC}\) and contains \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 704, 153, 722]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 704, 737, 722]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of \(m\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 704, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 734, 153, 752]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 734, 735, 752]]<|/det|>
Find the length of the perpendicular from \(C\) to the line through \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 734, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
